pronunciation: OPPRESS', [Latin appressus, from opprimo; ob and premo, to press.]

definitions.text:
1. To load or burden with unreasonable impositions; treat with unjust severity, rigor or hardship; as, oppress nation with taxes or contributions; oppress one by compelling him perform unreasonable service.
2. To overpower; overburden; as, be oppressed with grief.
3. sit or lie heavy on; as, excess of good oppresses the stomach.
